title: Kids' sleep may suffer from moms' tight work schedules

title_detail.value: Kids' sleep may suffer from moms' tight work schedules

summary: After studying the sleep habits of children from ages five to nine, researchers found that when mothers reported less flexibility in their work schedules, their children got less sleep. When they gained flexibility in their work schedules, their children slept more.

summary_detail.value: After studying the sleep habits of children from ages five to nine, researchers found that when mothers reported less flexibility in their work schedules, their children got less sleep. When they gained flexibility in their work schedules, their children slept more.
